claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: Text excerpt from the introduction of a vaccine study, describing the use of embryonated hen’s eggs for influenza vaccine production and its logistical drawbacks (specialized facilities, limited scale-up, vulnerability to subtypes). The image does not support the claim because it only outlines general production challenges of egg-based vaccines and makes no mention of mutations arising during egg or cell culture or any impact on effectiveness. does not support the claim Note: Only introductory text is visible; no data or statements about viral mutations or reduced vaccine effectiveness are shown.
